fields.description:
I downloaded the latest version of SourceTree 3.1.2_216 from this page:

[https://www.sourcetreeapp.com/]

[https://product-downloads.atlassian.com/software/sourcetree/ga/Sourcetree_3.1.2_216.zip]

When I unzipped it, I was unable to run it.

When I launched it, it says:

The application "Sourcetree.app" can't be opened

 
When I looked in the console, I saw this error:

Non-fatal error enumerating at <private>, continuing: Error Domain=NSCocoaErrorDomain Code=260 "The file “PlugIns” couldn’t be opened because there is no such file." UserInfo=\{NSURL=PlugIns/ -- file:///Applications/Sourcetree.app/Contents/, NSFilePath=/Applications/Sourcetree.app/Contents/PlugIns, NSUnderlyingError=0x7f9b6de23d70 {Error Domain=NSPOSIXErrorDomain Code=2 "No such file or directory"}}
 
p.s. When I found Source Tree 3.2 from OSX_Latest.zip on this page:

[https://bitbucket.org/atlassianlabs/sourcetree-betas/downloads/]

it worked fine.

So, please remove Source Tree 3.1.2 from the downloads page and put 3.2 or later in its place.
fields.summary: The application "Sourcetree.app" can't be opened

fields.description: Add automatic dark and light theme switching based on OSX settings or time of day
fields.summary: Automatic dark and light theme switching

fields.description:
When changing screen resolutions on OSX, occasionally, the source tree logo will be scaled incorrectly.

I noticed this when mirroring my 2019 MBP to an external screen, and then unplugging the HDMI cable. My primary display changed resolution automatically, and the window looked scaled incorrectly.
fields.summary: SourceTree Logo Scaling issue when changing screen resolutions (OSX)

fields.description:
Would like to see the kanban backlog view recently introduced to have the same sidebar menus that the scrum backlog view has: epics and versions.

Our product manage still has epics even though we use kanban, and its important to be able to see these in the sidebar as well as in the list view like in the standard scrum board. Its also important to be able to see fixversion information here in the list view.

Unfortunately, missing this extra information severely limits the utility of the backlog view in kanban boards.
fields.summary: Epic list in kanban backlog view (labs)

fields.description:
on mac mojave, in diff view, the color of separate bar between hunks is incorrect in theme light.

 

!QQ20190608-214111@2x.png!

 

but it's correct in dark theme

 

 

!QQ20190608-214134@2x.png!
fields.summary: on mac mojave, in diff view, the color of separate bar between hunks is incorrect

fields.description:
Immediately crashes on startup.

Installed old version, now that version doesn't work either.

Removed Sourcetree.app, installed new version from scratch, still fails.

Removed "imagecache" from application support as suggested in some online forums, no difference.

Now that I've upgraded, no 3.x versions work.  I can't use sourcetree at all now.

fields.description: Sourcetree v3.2 cannot use Beyond Compare anymore and you cannot edit Diff/Diff commands and arguments and the fields are empty.

fields.description:
In the [History view|https://confluence.atlassian.com/get-started-with-sourcetree/repository-history-and-code-diffs-847359147.html], if I deselect all commits (e.g. by {{Cmd+Click}} in the currently selected commit), the list of files becomes empty (which is expected) but the commit message and diff sections retain the previous content, resulting in an inconsistent state that furthermore takes up useful screen space.

I'd expect the entire lower half of the view (where the commit details are shown) to disappear, and reappear once one or more commits are selected.
fields.summary: Hide commit details pane in History view when no commits are selected

fields.description:
The draggable area of the window only extends about an inch past the "Help" menu item, leaving the rest of the space non-responsive to dragging.

 

The mouse cursor in the attached screenshot indicates the start of the area where dragging the window does not work.  (Everywhere to the right of the mouse cursor.)

There are probably a billion of ways for this to happen since I'm a developer and install, uninstall, and upgrade programs all the time. Problem and solution are here: https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Sourcetree-questions/external-diff-stopped-working/qaq-p/970290

fields.description: When I finish a hotfix, I check "Tag with this message". As default it use the branch name to tag it. But I want to use a new tag name. It's not working.

Expected result: the app  keeps working 

Actual result: The app stops, the error occurs

fields.description:
Шаги воспроизведения:

# открыть мобильное приложение https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.uz.bookinguz&hl=uk
# Перейти в меню "Купить билет"
# Заполнить необходимые поля (станция отправления, странция прибытия, дата и время отправки)
# Выбрать поезд, тип вагона 
# Выбрать место в вагоне
# Ввести ФИО пассажира, выбрать тип билета и доп. услуги, отправить билет в корзину
# Нажать кнопку "оплатить", согласиться с договором оферты
# Ввести данные карты для оплаты в соответсвенные поля, нажать кнопку оплатить
# Подтвердить оплату с помощью otp-пароля или другим доступным способом.


После перенаправления на страницу подтверждения платежа мобильного интернет-банкинга, в случае неуспешной оплаты со стороны банка - нет информации об ошибке и неудачной покупке билета со стороны мобильного приложения УЗ.

Ожидаемый результат: сообщение об ошибке и предложение повторить оплату.
Фактический результат: отсутствие информирования клиента об отказе при покупке билета.
fields.summary: Тестирование мобильного приложения на android  "Железнодорожные билеты" от АТ"Укрзалізниця". При неуспешной оплате билета нет уведомления об ошибке и результата оплаты.

fields.description:
шаги проверки:
1. выбирать приложение Железнодорожные билеты  АТ"Укрзалізниця" в Google Play
2. установить приложение на смартфон с операционной системой Android
3. нажать на Купить билет
4. повернуть телефон в горизонтальное положение
ожидаемы результат:
все данные в меню Купить билет отображаются
фактический результат:
меню пропадает и появляется другая информация У Вас нет актуальных билетов
fields.summary: при автоповороте экрана изображения пропадают

fields.description:
The download button at sourcetreeapp.com reads "Download for Mac OS X".

Apple's OS is called macOS. "Mac OS X" is no longer used by Apple since Sep 2016, when macOS 10.12 Sierra was released.

It'd be great if [www.sourcetreeapp.com|http://www.sourcetreeapp.com/] could be updated to reflect this change.
fields.summary: Update download button at sourcetreeapp.com to read "Download for macOS" instead of "Download for Mac OS X"

fields.description: This issue happens for two different remote git repos. When I make file changes, the file status view does not show a number icon showing how many files havez been changed. !Screen Shot 2019-05-24 at 8.37.01 AM.png!
fields.summary: File status view not showing number icon

fields.description:
When you choose "Search" in the left navigation panel, you get a little drop-down for the search type, containing these options:
 * Commit Message
 * Commit SHA
 * Branch
 * File Changes
 * User

The problem is that this drop-down is allocated so little space in the UI that the labels are truncated to:
 * Commit...
 * CommitS...
 * Branch
 * File Chan...
 * User

Because the first option is the default, showing "Commit...", I can never tell whether it's on "Commit Message" or "Commit SHA". Here's what I'm talking about:

!image-2019-05-23-10-53-28-927.png!

There's soooooo much space allocated to the search field, but so little to the "search type" drop-down. Could we maybe allocate a few more pixels to the width of this drop-down, for improved usability? Ideally we'd be able to read the entire label of each option, e.g. "Commit Message" rather than something with a "..." at the end.
fields.summary: Show all of "search type" picker

fields.description:
SourceTree intercepts URL calls to GitHub even for OAuth login. I assume this is wrong, but have no idea. Regardless... the end result is that refreshing is not working.

See [this video|https://youtu.be/AOv5goBxoPI] for the issue.
fields.summary: GitHub URL for OAuth intercepted by SourceTree

fields.description:
There seems to be a problem with "Log selected" option.

I'm trying to show a log for not modified file. In "File Status" window (filter: all, tree view) I pick a file, right click it and I can see that "Log selected" option is active. After clicking it nothing happens. No error, no new window opens. /dev/null
fields.summary: "Log selected" does nothing
Bitbucket pipeline activation

fields.description:
I'm running Sourcetree 3.1.2.

I'd like to see the ability for Custom Actions to be available via right-click on diffs, so I can right-click to open a Custom Action, with the action being passed the specific $LINE I clicked, so I can open up to that particular line in my IDE (e.g., as Atom allows command line: https://stackoverflow.com/a/48096096/271577 ). (I'd suggest $COL too if there were contexts that might use it, but Sourcetree currently highlights the whole line with right click--as makes sense.)

Ideally there'd be two right-click options, one to run a custom action against the prior version's line number and with its $FILE pointing to the prior version, and another to run a custom action on the next version. (If it could find where that line is in the current version, that'd be even better, but I assume this would often not be possible.)
fields.summary: Expose Custom Actions menu to diffs and pass $LINE info (like $REPO/$FILE/$SHA) and make $FILE specific to diff

fields.description:
When I add my Github to Sourcetree it lists all my Public Repos but not the Private ones.

I've tried removing the account and re-adding it - same thing.
fields.summary: Not able to access Github Private Repo's - even if I own them

fields.description:
When initialising a new GitFLow for a repository and specifying a different prefix for feature branch, it is not respected. Steps to reproduce:
 # Create a new empty repository
 # Start initialising a new GitFlow
 # Specify features prefix to be "features/" instead of" feature/"
 # Click OK
 # In Finder open the empty repository .git/config
 # Observe GitFLow config is:

[gitflow "prefix"]
    feature = feature/
 # Expected:

[gitflow "prefix"]
    feature = features/
fields.summary: GitFLow initialize does not use modified branch prefixes

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
 * open a project and go to fullscreen mode
 * perform an action that produces a sheet
 * notice that the sheet is not visible in current space, but is visible in another space (and when you with to that space, it switches you back immediately)

With those steps it doesn't usually happen immediately, but with these alternate steps it is always reproducible:
 * open a project and go to fullscreen mode
 * open another project
 * merge all windows into the fullscreen project (Window -> Merge all windows)
 * split the merged windows apart by dragging the tab
 * perform an action that produces a sheet (on either project)
 * notice that the sheet is not visible in current space, but is visible in another space (and when you with to that space, it switches you back immediately)

Sometimes it works fine, but when I use it long enough in fullscreen mode, it always seems to have this issue (sheets opening in the wrong space) eventually. Sometimes the space the sheet open in doesn't even have a project window in it.

 

I noticed this issue in previous versions, but it seems to happen more often in this version, and is harder to fix (by leaving fullscreen mode, reopening windows, etc.) than in previous versions.
fields.summary: Most sheets open in wrong space in fullscreen mode

fields.description:
Advised by Brian Ganninger to open a ticket after asking the following question to the community:

[https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Sourcetree-questions/Git-tags-that-have-been-removed-via-the-command-line-locally-and/qaq-p/1079876?utm_source=atlcomm&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=mentions_answer&utm_content=topic]

 

To delete all my local tags I ran `git submodule foreach --recursive 'git tag | xargs git tag -d'`
To fetch all the remote tags `git submodule foreach --recursive git fetch -t`

Ran `git tag -l` to verify that only the tags that should exist still do.

Saw no change in the tags on SourceTree (does not refresh)

Closed SourceTree and reopened it.

Still has phantom tags listed.

If I push from SourceTree the tags that should not be there will be recreated remotely.
fields.summary: Git tags that have been removed via the command line (zsh) locally and remotely still appear in SourceTree

fields.description:
Allow copying a commit's description, commit id, author, and date, via command-C, when viewing commits in the history view. (Would also be nice to copy same info from results in Search view.)

Selecting multiple rows will copy the data from all the rows.

After copying it, I could paste the text into a text editor as tab delimited text, or into a spreadsheet.

Why?

I need to look at multiple commits on multiple branches, having a text file or XL file will let me add comments to those commits, such as "this commit has nothing to do with our issue X that was committed 6 months ago and only reported now". Or my boss wants a listing of everything in X release, and we didn't have a better way to integrate that data or track it, so raw commits give us a decent report. Or I need to compare all commits in X branch against what was merged into Y branch. Or maybe I need to copy the commit and ask a coworker to give better commit messages ;).

 

(hopefully attached image comes through, got an error "Jira could not attach file as there was a missing token")
fields.summary: Allow copying commit description in history view

fields.description: my remote branch disallow checkout from double-click, why it can't be a give me dialog above "please checkout and pull -> yes"?
fields.summary: bad error "branch already exists"

fields.description:
In Sourcetree, if I view the `File status` tab using `Tree View` and `Split view staging`, I encounter a persistent error.

If I select a directory containing files that have changes, the right panel of the app shows a spinner while loading the diff of all files in the folder. Eventually the diff of all files renders, and about 3 seconds later it disappears, leaving a white void.

This happens the first time a diff is loaded for any directory. If I select a different file or directory in the list of staged or unstaged files, and then select the original directory that had a crashed diff view, it will load, and then does not crash. But the first time a diff of a directory is loaded, it crashes every time. If a file within the directory changes state in any way (save, stage, unstage, etc) the diff of the folder will again crash the next time it is viewed.
fields.summary: Diff of Folder Loads and then Disappears

fields.summary: Mac下新版source tree 十分卡顿，不知道为什么？
Remove accidental discarding of all changes
Bitbucket Server"

fields.description:
I see many tickets requesting specific new keyboard shortcuts. This isn't that. It's a request to fully rethink the keyboard shortcuts.

*As a SourceTree user, I want to use simple-to-remember-and-trigger keyboard shortcuts so that I can work more quickly.*

Since there are very few areas within SourceTree where you actually type text, why not go with simple single-key keyboard shortcuts for everyday actions? Less frequently used action can be hidden behind key combos.

These aren't fully baked but here's a subset of ideas mostly just to illustrate the concept.

*Unstaged/stage files pane:*
 A = Add to index (or remove if in staged list — like SPACE now)
 R = Revert
 O = Open file
 D = External Diff
 I = Ignore
 U = Unstage?

*Diff pane:*
 J = Previous Hunk
 K = Next Hunk
 A = Stage Hunk (or selected lines)
 D = Discard Hunk
 Or, better:
 R = Revert Hunk (and the button would be renamed)
 Which leaves D for External Diff. :)

*Branch pane:*
 / = search for next (enable the current key based jumping. Bonus if it allowed longer strings like regular search)
 R = Rebase
 I = Interactive Rebase
 B = Create a new branch
 P = Push (with branch selected)
 M = Merge

*Everywhere?*
 CTRL+arrow = switch panes (or alt or whatevs)
 C = Commit
 F = Fetch
 M = Merge
 P = Push
 CMD+P = Pull?
 S = Stash
 V = View in finder/explorer/...
 T = Open Terminal
 SPACE = Quicklook (on OSX anyway). Would include staging panes, etc.

Again, not married to the specific shortcuts—only meant to illustrate the concept. Just think SourceTree has an opportunity to make these commands _much_ easier to remember.
fields.summary: Simplified keyboard navigation - single keys

fields.description:
It used to be possible to drag commits in the listbox to reorder them. Now, I find I can no longer drag to lines between commits to insert it–with drag-and-drop, only combining is possible.

Until recently I was able to get around that by simply dragging each commit to the space at the bottom of the listbox, inserting them in the reverse order I wanted--but with the introduction of additional bugs that is no longer possible. The dialog now resizes itself to leave no space, and although there is a draggable bar (mouse cursor changes), it is not draggable–attempting to drag it causes a visual artifact but no resizing.

Finally, on combining two commits, I now see a dialog reading "Blah" (attached).
fields.summary: Interactive Rebase: 1) prevents reordering 2) sized wrong 3) says "Blah"

fields.description:
Please add the line number ($LINE) to the available template variables ($REPO, $FILE, $SHA) for Custom Actions.  Specifically, I want to be able to open my IDE to a file at a selected line in a difference.  Best would be to be able to do this based on the selection (using the menu or keyboard shortcut) and also to access it from the context menu by right-clicking a line in the difference.view.

 

I recognize the following subtlety: In contexts other than the difference viewer, there is no line number, and it would be preferable in most cases *_not_* to make one up (not to use "1" since that would lose context if an editor was already live in the IDE at a sensible place.)  You also cannot simply leave it blank in no-line contexts, since that would cause errors.  E.g., neither {{/usr/local/bin/idea --line _(missing)_ /path/to/file}}, nor with a colon, {{/usr/local/bin/idea --line /path/to/file:_(missing)_}} will work properly.  One suggestion would be a checkbox on the custom action form to say "Include line number" that when checked would provide space for a second parameters specifications, the second being for contexts with $LINE.  (It could show an error if the first has $LINE, and an error if the second does not.)

I think it's a very essentail capability to be able to jump to an edit in a comfortable editor and tweak it before finishing a commit.
fields.summary: $LINE for Custom Action specifications

fields.description: Default font for git command log is not fixed-width, breaking ASCII art.
fields.summary: Git log window needs default fixed width font

fields.description: I have some custom actions which are specific to single repository, and irrelevant to others. I'd like to have an option to show these custom actions only when working on that repository
fields.summary: Allow repository-specific custom actions

fields.summary: Log Selected is disabled when file name including the tilde

fields.description:
I had to move my home directory, under which every one of my repositories were located.

Now it turns out that Sourcetree cannot find a single of my bookmarks.

 

If I make a broad scan for repos then all of them are just added without any folder structure. Even if the folder structure for my bookmarks isn't necessarily the same as in my filesystem, it would still have been better than nothing.

 

There's no obvious way to edit the base URL of all bookmarks. I'm left only with the option to throw away all categorisation into folders that I've done.

 

Aren't you storing paths into my home directory as paths relative to my home directory? Why not?
fields.summary: Bookmarks don't use relative paths from my home directory?

fields.description: When searching for and inspecting old commits, it would be very helpful to be able to expand to show more lines of context in Search just as we already can in History.

fields.summary: Subtree
Appendix "Raiwei tickets": when you select a ticket in the phone, the error works in a vertical position - in the horizontal position you get the error "You do not have any actual tickets".

fields.description:
I used to be able to use Sourcetree to create new repositories where the Name field contained spaces and caps like "My New Repository 1".  This would create a new repository that would show up in my Bitbucket profile with a pretty name "My New Repository 1" but the slug would automatically be "my-new-repository-1."

Now when I try to create new repositories like this, I get one of two error messages. If the name of the new repository contains spaces "My New Repository" I get this error: `The operation couldn’t be completed. (com.google.GTMSessionFetcher error -1.)`

If the name of the new repository does not contain spaces but does contain a number like "MyRepository2", I get this error: `message: Invalid slug. Slugs must be lowercase, alphanumerical, and may also contain underscores, dashes, or dots.`

Apparently Sourcetree's autoupdater was broken so I only recently upgraded from 2.0.5.2b0 to 2.5 so I can't say when this bug appeared. I'm connected with Bitbucket over ssh, not sure if that matters. I can replicate this behavior on a different Mac with an unrelated Bitbucket account connected in the same way.
fields.summary: Cannot create new remote repositories with caps, spaces, or numbers

fields.description:
wanted to test a merge from master to develop, after a hot fix 
 * create a branch on develop, called merge/master-2.4.1
 * make that branch the active one
 * right click on master to merge master into merge/master-2.4.1
 * we see the commit message "Merge branch 'master' into merge/master-2.4.1"
 * we do not expect that the merge is also done into develop, but that is what happened. basically, development and  merge/master-2.4.1 are identical at the merge point, and resolving the conflicts in the merge are happening on merge/master-2.4.1
fields.summary: creating a feature branch on develop for doing a merge fro master to develop results in a merge into develop and then in creation of the feature branch

fields.description: Can you please implement URL schema support for 'git+https' the same way as you do for 'git+ssh" already?
fields.summary: Support for git+https URL schema

fields.description:
When i try to pull via SourceTree from a remote repository remote branches are always empty at first. I can retrieve remote branches by pressing 'refresh'. But i have to do this every time i launch this dialog. Even if i close and immediately open it again. I've compared this with my other MacBook and a MacBook of my colleague. Both installed SourceTree, having (almost) the same git-config. They do not have this problem. I removed and reinstalled SourceTree (even deleting files under ~/Library/Application Support) and it didn't solve the problem. After pressing 'refresh' remote branches are available for this moment. I also can see a loading spinner icon in the drop down menu when i open the pull dialog but there are not any results. Only after manually refreshing them.

The only difference between this Mac I'm having this issue and my second one is that I installed a plain SourceTree app on this one while I had the AppStore version installed on the second one before.

The last update didn't fix this issue. The issue occurs in every repository every time. It doesn't occur on the other Macs where the same repositories are used.

If necessary I can provide further details.
fields.summary: Remote Branches to Pull Are Always Empty

fields.description: _The patient’s card_ *_is not saved_* _in the patient database after clicking the «Save» button_

fields.description:
Windows version of the app allows fetching changes from non-current branches by right clicking the branch of interest and selecting "Fetch <branch>" from the context menu.

This functionality is absent on OSX version of the app.

Please make OSX version on par with Windows in that regards.
fields.summary: No Fetch command in context menu on OSX for a non-current branch

fields.description:
Default behavior on OSX is to open each repo in a separate window.
There is a "Merge All Windows" command, but it's effect is transient.
On app restart all the repos are opened in separate windows again. Merge All Windows does not retain tab order, so it's pretty annoying to have windows merged and tabs rearranged on each app relaunch or OS restart.
Windows version of the app doesn't have this issue. It defaults to "tabbed" view and it retains tab order on relaunch.
Please make OSX version feature-equivalent with Windows version.
Adding a preference option for "tabbed view" vs "open each repo in a separate window" might be a good idea.
At minimum retain the last "merged/separate" status and tab order on relaunch.
fields.summary: Merge Windows state is not retained across app restarts

fields.description:
Remote refresh fails silently and doesn't even let you know when it last happened successfully. It has already lulled me a couple of times into missing something because I assumed the shown state was fresher than my <configured num of minutes>.

So I'm disabling it to force myself to fetch manually. Which is a pity.

It would be a nice feature if it worked reliably.
fields.summary: Automatic remote refresh unreliable to the point of harmful

fields.description:
Searching in File Changes does return a number of commits that contain the searched-for text, and one can select any of those commits to see its contents.

But typically each found commit affects multiple files, and there is no way to know which of the affected files does contain the searched-for text.

This makes the search functionality almost useless.
fields.summary: Search in File Changes finds commits but does not point to concrete file

fields.description:
Preview window does not work.
Do you have any solutions?
fields.summary: SourceTree 3.1.2 has no Preview for Git Flow

fields.description:
Currently SourceTree is shipped with Mercurial 4.6.1

Latest Mercurial versions have new repo format. So when clonning repo with command line, it is unusable with Source Tree.

Steps to reproduce:
 # Install mercurial (I have 4.9)
 # Clone any repo `hg clone https://bitbucket.org/coronalabs/samples-coronasdk`
 # Open repo with Source Tree `stree samples-coronasdk`
 # Getting error

!image-2019-04-08-10-25-48-115.png|width=413,height=239!

 

[https://mercurial-scm.org/wiki/MissingRequirement]

Error is due to new repository format in mercurial 4.7+

 

*Workaround:* in settings, Mercurial, press "Use System Mercurial"
fields.summary: Broken compatibility with command line mercurial

fields.description:
my OpenSSH id_ed25519 key from {{.ssh}} isn't detected so I can't load and use it in sourcetree and I'm therefor unable to add remote configurations in sourcetree.

 

Please add support for all known OpenSSH key encryptions

{{[-t dsa | ecdsa | ed25519 | rsa]}}

I expect actually only dsa and rsa are supported
fields.summary: SSH needs support for ed25519

fields.description:
I am having a usability issue. During rebasing on git, I almost always get confused as to which one is "Mine" or "Theirs"

Instead, could we have an option to list hash (or first 10 chars of the hash) instead of the words "Mine" and "Theirs". It will feel more definitive this way and I won't second guess myself.

 

 

!image-2019-04-04-12-53-32-464.png!
fields.summary: Rebasing: instead of "Mine" or "Theirs" use hash

fields.description: When creating a new branch, if you use a branch within a directory (which is already created), this works fine. However, when SourceTree automatically checks-out the branch after creating, it doesn't *expand* the directory where the branch is, which can be confusing and seem buggy, resulting in me trying to create the branch again thinking it was a bug.
fields.summary: Branch Directory Issue

fields.description:
Before updating Sourcetree it was version 2.6.x and the repository browser was ok. Each line contained <PROJECT KEY> / <REPO NAME>.

With the new version of Sourcetree the content of each line is reduced to solely <REPO NAME> and only distinct repo names are displayed. 

I think it is a concept error to allow equal repo names in different projects on Bitbucket in combination with the above stated behavior. 

You can also reproduce this misleading workflow from Sourcetree if you have two projects, each with one repo:
||Line||Description||
|repo1|Project *PR1* with repo *repo1*|
|repo2|Project *PR2* with repo *repo2*|

Now create a new repo from within Source. Name it *repo1* and choose Project *PR2* as parent. Depending on the load order the refresh could kick out the previously shown *repo1* from *PR1*.

The quick fix will be for us, that we have to rename all repositories.
fields.summary: Repository Browser List does not show repos with same name in different projects

fields.description:
I recently upgraded 3.0.17 to 3.1.2. Everything seemed to be running pretty well. A couple of days ago I noticed the application was not responding after about 1 minute and was taking an enormous amount of memory and CPU usage. I started the process log and noticed the application was scanning everything in the C drive.

 

I have since uninstalled 3.1.2 and re-installed 3.0.17 and the issue has gone away. So the issue seems to be limited to the newest version of SourceTree.


 





 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

I am attaching the log file, a screenshot of the 3.0.17 ProcessLog, and a screenshot of the 3.1.2 ProcessLog  for you.
fields.summary: Sourcetree 3.1.2 Not Responding

fields.description:
Cannot launch sourcetree application after installation. maybe something wrong with my environment, I hava try to change older version of sourcetree, but none of them work,

I found the log file and only see one kind of error:
{code:java}
// sourcetree.log
ERROR [2019-04-02 12:40:30,900] [1] [Sourcetree.Composition.VSMef.Net471.CompositionExceptionHelper] [Log] - PartDiscoveryException:
Microsoft.VisualStudio.Composition.PartDiscoveryException: Unable to load assembly "C:\Users\yindongchao\AppData\Local\SourceTree\app-3.1.2\SourceTree.exe" for scanning. ---> System.IO.FileLoadException: 未能加载文件或程序集“Sourcetree, Version=3.1.2.3027, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null”或它的某一个依赖项。找到的程序集清单定义与程序集引用不匹配。 (异常来自 HRESULT:0x80131040)
   在 System.Reflection.RuntimeAssembly._nLoad(AssemblyName fileName, String codeBase, Evidence assemblySecurity, RuntimeAssembly locationHint, StackCrawlMark& stackMark, IntPtr pPrivHostBinder, Boolean throwOnFileNotFound, Boolean forIntrospection, Boolean suppressSecurityChecks)
   在 System.Reflection.RuntimeAssembly.InternalLoadAssemblyName(AssemblyName assemblyRef, Evidence assemblySecurity, RuntimeAssembly reqAssembly, StackCrawlMark& stackMark, IntPtr pPrivHostBinder, Boolean throwOnFileNotFound, Boolean forIntrospection, Boolean suppressSecurityChecks)
   在 System.Reflection.Assembly.Load(AssemblyName assemblyRef)
   在 Microsoft.VisualStudio.Composition.PartDiscovery.<>c__DisplayClass11_0.<CreatePartsAsync>b__0(String path)
   --- 内部异常堆栈跟踪的结尾 ---


{code}
The whole log file attached below.

help plz.
fields.summary: Can not launch sourcetree after installation.

fields.description: With many tags, it is hard to see your branches just the same as if you have many branches. At least with many remote branches you can hide remote branches. There could simply be a toggle next to "Hide Remote Branches" to "Hide Tags."
fields.summary: Omit tags from tree view

fields.description:
There are only two options for displaying commit tree: "Current Branch" and "All Branches". It is really hard to work with several branches if your team is quite large and there are hundreds of commits. For example, if you need to cherry-pick a commit, you have to select "All Branches" - and then you just get lost.

It would be really great to have an option "Selected Brances": you have selected your current branch and you can select another branch to compare, find common parent, cherry-pick...

 

Thank you!
fields.summary: Ability to display commit tree for selected branches only

fields.description:
git hooks are run in an environment without `/usr/local/bin/` on the `PATH`, even though this is always on the `PATH` on macOS, even in a very bare shell (cf `env -i bash --norc --noprofile`).

```

/Applications/Sourcetree.app/Contents/Resources/git_local/libexec/git-core:/Applications/Sourcetree.app/Contents/Resources/bin:/Applications/Sourcetree.app/Contents/Resources/git_local/bin:/Applications/Sourcetree.app/Contents/Resources/git_local/gitflow:/Applications/Sourcetree.app/Contents/Resources/git_local/git-lfs:/usr/bin:/bin:/usr/sbin:/sbin
```

This means that hooks in particular can't use `/usr/bin/env python3`, without having to add `/usr/local/bin/` to the `PATH` themselves.
fields.summary: hooks run with PATH missing /usr/local/bin/

fields.description: https://youtu.be/6xpJ6NbQPQc
fields.summary: Can not finish register step

fields.description:
For some reason our repo performs terribly with Sourcetree - when dealing with staging/unstaging/resetting files with large sets of changes it is almost unusable due to endless loading spinners. It seems to be constantly hanging while talking to git and refreshing.

Our repo is reasonably unique but I have seen this with other repositories in the past and it's an ongoing issue with sourcetree. More and more I'm returning to the command line to do stuff. e.g. stashing - It's just SO slow with sourcetree to stash, switch branch and then pop.

I would love to see Sourcetree double down on becoming a lightning fast experience that is comparable to the command line, especially in complex situations which is where I need it most!

 

A bit about the current repo I am dealing with:We store a lot of pngs in the repo (for ui verification) but we chose not to bloat git itself with binaries, so we opted to use git-lfs for the storage of these. We store a number of other binaries that rarely change in the repository in the same way. We have reasonably complex pre-commit checks set up Otherwise the only other thing I can think of is we have a single (small) submodule attached to the project.

Breakdown of my local .git directory is:

 
Size
||Size||Directory||
|714M|./objects|
|664K|./info|
|380K|./logs |
|80K  |./hooks|
|15M |./worktrees|
|844K ./refs|./refs|
|1.0G ./lfs|./lfs|
|0B |./branches|
|2.7M |./modules|
fields.summary: Sourcetree is painfully slow when dealing with large changes / repos

fields.description:
There's no way in the program to stash untracked files, since the checkbox no longer actually stages the files. Previously I could check the box to stage all my untracked files, then hit Stash and they'd be stashed. This is unavailable in the current version – checking the box and then hitting Stash doesn't stash new files.

It looks like Git has support now for stashing untracked files with "git stash --include-untracked". Perhaps this could be added as a checkbox option in the "Stash" dialog.
fields.summary: Clicking checkbox to stage files and then "Stash" to stash previously untracked files doesn't work anymore

fields.description: In the "file status" view, if I want to discard changes to a file or remove it, I have to use the 3-dot button to the right of the file name. However, this button is so small to be almost unclickable. In the attached screenshot I'm hovering over it with my mouse (pointer not shown in screenshot). It was quite a bit bigger in an earlier version of Sourcetree (not sure which version exactly).
fields.summary: File options button in "File Status" view is too small, almost unclickable

fields.description: Gitflow modals are too small.
fields.summary: Gitflow options modals too small

fields.description:
We have a large (Mercurial) repository

After a commit, the repo-window refreshes.

If you close that window 'to soon', then SourceTree crashes 1 out of 2
fields.summary: SourceTree crashes when closing a window during refresh

fields.description:
I regularly submit from SourceTree to Mercurial where I select the files to submit (so, not all changed files).

This used to work until 3.0, but now in 3.1 this no longer works.

You see the information is processed, but I think the actual (local) commit to the repository fails without further info.

After that, SourceTree is confused about the status of the files etc.

I had to go back to an older version to be able to continue my work
fields.summary: cannot submit when only a subset of files is selected

fields.description:
Шаги воспроизведения:

1. Запустить приложение "Уз"
2. Выбрать пункт "купить билет "
3. Заполнить поля "откуда" ,"куда", "дата", "время" любыми верифицированными значениями (Киев- Винница 28 марта 00:00)
4. Кликнуть "поиск поезда"
5. На вкладке "Выбор поезда" выбрать первый из списка 
6. На вкладке "Выбор мест" выбрать любое место
7. Кликнуть "Оформить"
8. На вкладке "Оформление" заполнить все поля допустимыми значениями 
9. В поле "Услуги" отметить галочкой "Постельное белье" ,"1 напиток" ,"2 напитка"
10. Кликнуть на кнопку " В корзину"
11. Приложение перейдет на вкладку "Корзина"

Ожидаемый результат : возможность отменить количество напитков на 1 либо 2 либо 0
Фактический результат: приложение считает в общую сумму билета цену за 3 напитка
fields.summary: Приложение "Уз" , отсутствуют ограничения в количестве , в поле услуги
In the application "Ukrzaliznytsya" the auto-rotate of the screen does not work, after clicking on the "Search for trains" button

fields.description:
I recreate this one as my previous ticket was closed as resolved: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREE-5807 *please don't close the issues as resolved when they aren't.*

Sourcetree maintain CPU usage very high. The fan works all the time till program is running. *We already got team members with swollen batteries due this!*
fields.summary: Hight CPU usage

fields.description:
Приложение УЗ v.1.10.4 

шаги воспроизведения

1.Запустить приложение "УЗ"

2. На вкладке "Направление" заполнить поля "Откуда", "Куда", "Дата", "Время" (Пример: Киев-Одесса, 29.03.19, 14:00)

3. Нажать на кнопку "Поиск поездов"

4. На вкладке "Выбор поезда" нажать на любой из предложенных поездов (Пример: Киев-Пассажирский - Одесса-Главная №148К)

5.Обраты тип вагона (Пример: купе) 
6.Обраты место (Пример: 7)

7.Натиснуты кнопку "Оформить"

8. Выбрать "Тип билета" - "Детский"

9.В поле "Дата рождения" вписать дату рождения более 14 лет (Пример: 05,09,2002)

10.Заповниты поле "Имя" (Пример: Павел)

11.Заповниты поле "Фамилия" (Пример: Павленко)

12. Заполнить поле "Услуги" (Пример: Постельное белье)

13. Нажать на кнопку "В корзину"

Ожидаемый результат: сообщение об ошибке "Дата рождения ребенка превышает 14 лет"

Фактический результат: сообщение об ошибке "Общая ошибка"

 

!image-2019-03-26-15-55-30-934.png!
fields.summary: Додаток УЗ: некорректна помилка при введенні дати народження дитини
